\begin{DoxyCompactList}\small\item\em Visit the children of a particular cursor. \end{DoxyCompactList}\end{DoxyCompactItemize}


\subsection{Detailed Description}
These routines provide the ability to traverse the abstract syntax tree using cursors. 

\subsection{Typedef Documentation}
\mbox{\Hypertarget{group__CINDEX__CURSOR__TRAVERSAL_gabf842c9ee20048b596eb9dfe94bb1570}\label{group__CINDEX__CURSOR__TRAVERSAL_gabf842c9ee20048b596eb9dfe94bb1570}} 
\index{Traversing the A\+S\+T with cursors@{Traversing the A\+S\+T with cursors}!C\+X\+Cursor\+Visitor@{C\+X\+Cursor\+Visitor}}
\index{C\+X\+Cursor\+Visitor@{C\+X\+Cursor\+Visitor}!Traversing the A\+S\+T with cursors@{Traversing the A\+S\+T with cursors}}
\subsubsection{\texorpdfstring{C\+X\+Cursor\+Visitor}{CXCursorVisitor}}
{\footnotesize\ttfamily typedef enum \mbox{\hyperlink{group__CINDEX__CURSOR__TRAVERSAL_ga99a9058656e696b622fbefaf5207d715}{C\+X\+Child\+Visit\+Result}}($\ast$ C\+X\+Cursor\+Visitor) (\mbox{\hyperlink{structCXCursor}{C\+X\+Cursor}} cursor, \mbox{\hyperlink{structCXCursor}{C\+X\+Cursor}} parent, \mbox{\hyperlink{group__CINDEX_gacfa40c3de26d228c0d898403c2c21612}{C\+X\+Client\+Data}} client\+\_\+data)}



Visitor invoked for each cursor found by a traversal. 

This visitor function will be invoked for each cursor found by clang\+\_\+visit\+Cursor\+Children(). Its first argument is the cursor being visited, its second argument is the parent visitor for that cursor, and its third argument is the client data provided to clang\+\_\+visit\+Cursor\+Children().

The visitor should return one of the {\ttfamily C\+X\+Child\+Visit\+Result} values to direct clang\+\_\+visit\+Cursor\+Children(). 

\subsection{Enumeration Type Documentation}
\mbox{\Hypertarget{group__CINDEX__CURSOR__TRAVERSAL_ga99a9058656e696b622fbefaf5207d715}\label{group__CINDEX__CURSOR__TRAVERSAL_ga99a9058656e696b622fbefaf5207d715}} 
\index{Traversing the A\+S\+T with cursors@{Traversing the A\+S\+T with cursors}!C\+X\+Child\+Visit\+Result@{C\+X\+Child\+Visit\+Result}}
\index{C\+X\+Child\+Visit\+Result@{C\+X\+Child\+Visit\+Result}!Traversing the A\+S\+T with cursors@{Traversing the A\+S\+T with cursors}}
\subsubsection{\texorpdfstring{C\+X\+Child\+Visit\+Result}{CXChildVisitResult}}
{\footnotesize\ttfamily enum \mbox{\hyperlink{group__CINDEX__CURSOR__TRAVERSAL_ga99a9058656e696b622fbefaf5207d715}{C\+X\+Child\+Visit\+Result}}}



Describes how the traversal of the children of a particular cursor should proceed after visiting a particular child cursor. 

A value of this enumeration type should be returned by each {\ttfamily C\+X\+Cursor\+Visitor} to indicate how \mbox{\hyperlink{group__CINDEX__CURSOR__TRAVERSAL_ga5d0a813d937e1a7dcc35f206ad1f7a91}{clang\+\_\+visit\+Children()}} proceed. \begin{DoxyEnumFields}{Enumerator}
\raisebox{\heightof{T}}[0pt][0pt]{\index{C\+X\+Child\+Visit\+\_\+\+Break@{C\+X\+Child\+Visit\+\_\+\+Break}!Traversing the A\+S\+T with cursors@{Traversing the A\+S\+T with cursors}}\index{Traversing the A\+S\+T with cursors@{Traversing the A\+S\+T with cursors}!C\+X\+Child\+Visit\+\_\+\+Break@{C\+X\+Child\+Visit\+\_\+\+Break}}}\mbox{\Hypertarget{group__CINDEX__CURSOR__TRAVERSAL_gga99a9058656e696b622fbefaf5207d715a0c5350aa7e393b623b93338d0c6c037b}\label{group__CINDEX__CURSOR__TRAVERSAL_gga99a9058656e696b622fbefaf5207d715a0c5350aa7e393b623b93338d0c6c037b}} 
C\+X\+Child\+Visit\+\_\+\+Break&Terminates the cursor traversal. \\
\hline

\raisebox{\heightof{T}}[0pt][0pt]{\index{C\+X\+Child\+Visit\+\_\+\+Continue@{C\+X\+Child\+Visit\+\_\+\+Continue}!Traversing the A\+S\+T with cursors@{Traversing the A\+S\+T with cursors}}\index{Traversing the A\+S\+T with cursors@{Traversing the A\+S\+T with cursors}!C\+X\+Child\+Visit\+\_\+\+Continue@{C\+X\+Child\+Visit\+\_\+\+Continue}}}\mbox{\Hypertarget{group__CINDEX__CURSOR__TRAVERSAL_gga99a9058656e696b622fbefaf5207d715a80e20ce8a41365f0a73c6dd3177488da}\label{group__CINDEX__CURSOR__TRAVERSAL_gga99a9058656e696b622fbefaf5207d715a80e20ce8a41365f0a73c6dd3177488da}} 
C\+X\+Child\+Visit\+\_\+\+Continue&Continues the cursor traversal with the next sibling of the cursor just visited, without visiting its children. \\
\hline

\raisebox{\heightof{T}}[0pt][0pt]{\index{C\+X\+Child\+Visit\+\_\+\+Recurse@{C\+X\+Child\+Visit\+\_\+\+Recurse}!Traversing the A\+S\+T with cursors@{Traversing the A\+S\+T with cursors}}\index{Traversing the A\+S\+T with cursors@{Traversing the A\+S\+T with cursors}!C\+X\+Child\+Visit\+\_\+\+Recurse@{C\+X\+Child\+Visit\+\_\+\+Recurse}}}\mbox{\Hypertarget{group__CINDEX__CURSOR__TRAVERSAL_gga99a9058656e696b622fbefaf5207d715a61a23204a2aa9670ceabb7b2b17c5100}\label{group__CINDEX__CURSOR__TRAVERSAL_gga99a9058656e696b622fbefaf5207d715a61a23204a2aa9670ceabb7b2b17c5100}} 
C\+X\+Child\+Visit\+\_\+\+Recurse&Recursively traverse the children of this cursor, using the same visitor and client data. \\
\hline

\end{DoxyEnumFields}


\subsection{Function Documentation}
\mbox{\Hypertarget{group__CINDEX__CURSOR__TRAVERSAL_ga5d0a813d937e1a7dcc35f206ad1f7a91}\label{group__CINDEX__CURSOR__TRAVERSAL_ga5d0a813d937e1a7dcc35f206ad1f7a91}} 
\index{Traversing the A\+S\+T with cursors@{Traversing the A\+S\+T with cursors}!clang\+\_\+visit\+Children@{clang\+\_\+visit\+Children}}
\index{clang\+\_\+visit\+Children@{clang\+\_\+visit\+Children}!Traversing the A\+S\+T with cursors@{Traversing the A\+S\+T with cursors}}
\subsubsection{\texorpdfstring{clang\+\_\+visit\+Children()}{clang\_visitChildren()}}
{\footnotesize\ttfamily C\+I\+N\+D\+E\+X\+\_\+\+L\+I\+N\+K\+A\+GE unsigned clang\+\_\+visit\+Children (\begin{DoxyParamCaption}\item[{\mbox{\hyperlink{structCXCursor}{C\+X\+Cursor}}}]{parent,  }\item[{\mbox{\hyperlink{group__CINDEX__CURSOR__TRAVERSAL_gabf842c9ee20048b596eb9dfe94bb1570}{C\+X\+Cursor\+Visitor}}}]{visitor,  }\item[{\mbox{\hyperlink{group__CINDEX_gacfa40c3de26d228c0d898403c2c21612}{C\+X\+Client\+Data}}}]{client\+\_\+data }\end{DoxyParamCaption})}



Visit the children of a particular cursor. 

This function visits all the direct children of the given cursor, invoking the given {\ttfamily visitor} function with the cursors of each visited child. The traversal may be recursive, if the visitor returns {\ttfamily C\+X\+Child\+Visit\+\_\+\+Recurse}. The traversal may also be ended prematurely, if the visitor returns {\ttfamily C\+X\+Child\+Visit\+\_\+\+Break}.


\begin{DoxyParams}{Parameters}
{\em parent} & the cursor whose child may be visited. All kinds of cursors can be visited, including invalid cursors (which, by definition, have no children).\\
\hline
{\em visitor} & the visitor function that will be invoked for each child of {\ttfamily parent}.\\
\hline
{\em client\+\_\+data} & pointer data supplied by the client, which will be passed to the visitor each time it is invoked.\\
\hline
\end{DoxyParams}
\begin{DoxyReturn}{Returns}
a non-\/zero value if the traversal was terminated prematurely by the visitor returning {\ttfamily C\+X\+Child\+Visit\+\_\+\+Break}. 
\end{DoxyReturn}
